verses.text: <a href="../2-Samuel-1-1/" title="2 Samuel 1:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1  "JESUS_END"Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

2 "JESUS_END"It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-3/" title="2 Samuel 1:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3  "JESUS_END"And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-4/" title="2 Samuel 1:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4  "JESUS_END"And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-5/" title="2 Samuel 1:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5  "JESUS_END"And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-6/" title="2 Samuel 1:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6  "JESUS_END"And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
7 "JESUS_END"And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.
8 "JESUS_END"And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
9 "JESUS_END"He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.

10 "JESUS_END"So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.
11 "JESUS_END"Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-12/" title="2 Samuel 1:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12  "JESUS_END"And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the LORD, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.
13 "JESUS_END"And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-14/" title="2 Samuel 1:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14  "JESUS_END"And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the LORD'S anointed?
15 "JESUS_END"And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.
16 "JESUS_END"And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD'S anointed.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-17/" title="2 Samuel 1:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17  "JESUS_END"And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:
18 "JESUS_END"(Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-19/" title="2 Samuel 1:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19  "JESUS_END"The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!
20 "JESUS_END"Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

21 "JESUS_END"Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-22/" title="2 Samuel 1:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22  "JESUS_END"From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.
23 "JESUS_END"Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
24 "JESUS_END"Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
25 "JESUS_END"How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-26/" title="2 Samuel 1:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26  "JESUS_END"I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-27/" title="2 Samuel 1:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27  "JESUS_END"How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
